org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.messages

Class RequestBase<RESPONSE_TYPE>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.agilewiki.jactor2.core.messages.RequestBase<RESPONSE_TYPE>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable, Message
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AsyncRequest, SyncRequest

    public abstract class RequestBase<RESPONSE_TYPE>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Message

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean foreign
      True when the result is to be returned via a targetReactor with a facility that differs from the facility of the target targetReactor.
      protected MessageSource messageSource
      The source reactor or pender that will receive the results.
      protected Message oldMessage
      The message targeted to the source reactor which, when processed, resulted in this message.
      protected java.lang.Object response
      The response created when this message is applied to the target blades.
      protected boolean responsePending
      True when a response to this message has not yet been determined.
      protected AsyncResponseProcessor responseProcessor
      The application object that will process the results.
      protected ExceptionHandler sourceExceptionHandler
      The exception handler that was active in the source targetReactor at the time when this message was created.
      protected ReactorBase targetReactor
      The targetReactor where this Request Object is passed for processing.
      protected boolean used
      A request can only be used once.

      • used

        protected boolean used
        A request can only be used once.

      • targetReactor

        protected final ReactorBase targetReactor
        The targetReactor where this Request Object is passed for processing. The thread owned by this targetReactor will process the Request.

      • RequestBase

        public RequestBase(Reactor _targetReactor)
        Create a RequestBase.
        Parameters:
        _targetReactor - The targetReactor where this Request Objects is passed for processing. The thread owned by this targetReactor will process this Request.

    • Method Detail

      • doSend

        public static <RESPONSE_TYPE> void doSend(Reactor _source,
                          RequestBase<RESPONSE_TYPE> _request,
                          AsyncResponseProcessor<RESPONSE_TYPE> _responseProcessor)
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Process the request immediately.
        Type Parameters:
        RESPONSE_TYPE - The type of value returned.
        Parameters:
        _source - The targetReactor on whose thread this method was invoked and which must be the same as the targetReactor of the target.
        _request - The request to be processed.
        _responseProcessor - Passed with this request and then returned with the result, the AsyncResponseProcessor is used to process the result on the same thread that originally invoked this method. If null, then no response is returned.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • getTargetReactor

        public Reactor getTargetReactor()
        Returns the Reactor to which this Request is bound and to which this Request is to be passed.
        Returns:
        The target Reactor.

      • use

        protected void use()
        Marks the request as having been used, or throws an exception if the request was already used.

      • signal

        public void signal()
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Passes this Request to the target Reactor without any result being passed back. I.E. The signal method results in a 1-way message being passed. If an exception is thrown while processing this Request, that exception is simply logged as a warning.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • call

        public RESPONSE_TYPE call()
                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Passes this Request to the target Reactor and blocks the current thread until a result is returned. The call method sends the message directly without buffering, as there is no targetReactor. The response message is buffered, though thread migration is not possible.
        Returns:
        The result from applying this Request to the target blades.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the result is an exception, it is thrown rather than being returned.

      • setResponse

        protected void setResponse(java.lang.Object _response,
               Reactor _activeReactor)
        Assigns a response to the request.
        Parameters:
        _response - the response being returned

      • processObjectResponse

        protected boolean processObjectResponse(java.lang.Object _response)
                                 throws java.lang.Exception
        The processObjectResponse method accepts the response of a request.

        This method need not be thread-safe, as it is always invoked from the same light-weight thread (targetReactor) that passed the Request.

        Parameters:
        _response - The response to a request.
        Returns:
        True when this is the first response.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • processException

        public void processException(Reactor _activeReactor,
                    java.lang.Exception _e)
        Description copied from interface: Message
        Process the throwable on the current thread in the facility of the active targetReactor.
        Specified by:
        processException in interface Message
        Parameters:
        _activeReactor - The targetReactor providing the facility for processing the throwable.
        _e - The exception to be processed.

      • setExceptionHandler

        public ExceptionHandler<RESPONSE_TYPE> setExceptionHandler(ExceptionHandler<RESPONSE_TYPE> _exceptionHandler)
        Replace the current ExceptionHandler with another.

        When an event or request message is processed by a targetReactor, the current exception handler is set to null. When a request is sent by a targetReactor, the current exception handler is saved in the outgoing message and restored when the response message is processed.

        Parameters:
        _exceptionHandler - The exception handler to be used now. May be null if the default exception handler is to be used.
        Returns:
        The exception handler that was previously in effect, or null if the default exception handler was in effect.

      • local

            throws java.lang.Exception
        Process the request immediately.
        Type Parameters:
        RT - The type of value returned.
        Parameters:
        _syncRequest - The request to be processed.
        Returns:
        The response from the request.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
